title: Ticket #2906: MOUNT_UNDER_SCRATCH and glexec don't play well together
description:
If MOUNT_UNDER_SCRATCH and ENABLE_GLEXEC are both set, then the condor_starter will fail to start jobs.

This is because MOUNT_UNDER_SCRATCH causes the sandbox directory to be pre-created (to create the new /tmp, for example) and glexec will die when trying to create the sandbox with the correct payload user.

The job goes on Hold with the following reason:

HoldReason = "Error from slot1@brian-test.unl.edu: error changing sandbox ownership to the user: condor_glexec_setup exited with status 256 and the following output: mkdir: cannot create directory `/var/lib/condor/execute/dir_23137': File exists"

There's little reason to run as root with ENABLE_GLEXEC besides developer debugging, but I wanted to record this incompatibility for future developers who also hit it.
